entry.title: the only house he ever owned (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Alexander Hamilton lived in the only house he ever owned (pictured) for just two years?

entry.title: In the Village of Guaraparim (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 16th-century In the Village of Guaraparim, written by a Catholic saint in a now-dead American language, features a character speaking "in a way that resembles the characters of Aristophanes"?

entry.title: Femke Bol (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Femke Bol broke the 41-year-old indoor world record for the 400 metres with a time of 49.26 seconds in 2023?

entry.title: Desulfovibrio vulgaris (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Desulfovibrio vulgaris can remove toxic heavy metals from the environment?

entry.title: Al Diaz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that graffiti artist Al Diaz cuts up New York metro signs and reconfigures the letters into his own text?

entry.title: Shukusei!! Loli Kami Requiem (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the initial lyrics to "Shukusei!! Loli Kami Requiem" were "as painful as hitting someone with concrete"?

entry.title: their first 20 seasons (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the New Orleans Saints went their first 20 seasons without a winning season?

entry.title: an office building in Virginia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that five peregrine falcon chicks were released from the roof of an office building in Virginia in an unsuccessful attempt to combat an overpopulation of pigeons?
